text:
Sonia hesitates by the table, gripping the book.  
Her heart races; she feels the tension.  
Sonia: “Haven’t you read it?”  
Raskolnikov: “Long ago… Read!”  
Sonia: “Haven’t you heard it in church?”  

---

Raskolnikov smiles faintly, sensing her unease.  
Raskolnikov: “You won’t go to your father’s funeral?”  
Sonia: “Yes, I shall. I had a requiem.”  
Raskolnikov: “For whom?”  
Sonia: “For Lizaveta. She was killed with an axe.”  

---

Raskolnikov's nerves fray, his head spins.  
Raskolnikov: “Were you friends with Lizaveta?”  
Sonia: “Yes... we used to read and talk.”  
Raskolnikov: “I’ll be a religious maniac soon!”  
Sonia: “Read!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov urges Sonia to read from the New Testament, revealing their shared connection to faith and loss.
